body.p:
To his Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned were members of the Jury who at the present term of the Livingston Circuit Court rendered a verdict of guilty against J. B. Lonjenette for selling ^or giving^ whiskey to the slave of Mr Canady -- The circumstances of the case were however such as constrain us to ask your Excellency to remit the fine. We think the case one of peculiar hardship, and the infliction of the fine not necessary for the laws vindication.
Augt. 1861

Respy
W. M Shoemaker
Levy Johnson
F A Slayden
W. L Tolley
John. S. Leffler
J. W. Mills
J. V. Scyster
M. H. Carson
J Womack
A. C. Metheney
J. L Hodge
Thos Croker
John Dunn
J. K. Huey --
The undersigned citizens of Livingston County, from their acquaintance with Mr. Lonjenette and his indigence, join in requesting the Governor to grant remit the fine in the within mentioned case --

Respy
Henry Roberts
Samuel. S. Barnett
James. M. Patterson
E. P. Haynes
John. W. Shelby
